publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2506.3 Mr Mark Ruskell: The Right to Protest at Gleneaglesâ€”As an amendment to motion (S2M-2506) in the name of Rosie Kane, insert at end "welcomes the topics under discussion at the summit and congratulates peaceful protest movements across the globe, who have pushed onto the agenda of the G8 crucial global issues such as climate change, debt and unfair trade, on their efforts; urges the Scottish Executive to ensure that the rights of both peaceful protestors and local residents in the Perthshire and Stirling areas are upheld by employing sensitive policing tactics that avoid intimidatory, inflammatory or discriminatory treatment; believes that insensitive policing could increase the likelihood of confrontation, and urges the Executive to support the establishment of a safe location for discussion, debate and peaceful protest in the southern Perthshire area." Supported by: Mark Ballard*
